sen.j: このわた（海鼠腸）は、ナマコの腸（はらわた）の塩辛である。
sen.e: Konowata is salted guts of a sea cucumber.
Konowata is salted guts of a sea cucumber.
Konowata is salted guts of a sea cucumber.

sen.j: 寒中に製した、また腸の長いものが、良品であるとされる。
sen.e: Konowata produced in mid-winter or with long guts is considered of good quality.
Konowata produced in mid-winter or with long guts is considered of good quality.
Konowata produced in mid-winter or with long guts is considered of good quality.

sen.j: ウニ、からすみと並んで日本三大一覧飲食物の一つに数えられる。
sen.e: Konowata is one of three major food and drink in Japan, together with sea urchin and karasumi (botargo.)
Konowata is one of three major food and drink in Japan, together with sea urchin and karasumi (botargo.)
Konowata is one of three major food and drink in Japan, together with sea urchin and karasumi (botargo.)

sen.j: 主な産地は伊勢、志摩、三河であった。
sen.e: The main production area was Ise, Shima, and Mikawa.
The main production areas were Ise, Shima, and Mikawa Provinces.
The main production areas were Ise, Shima, and Mikawa Provinces.

sen.j: 製法は、ナマコから脱腸器で腸を抜き取り、これを海水でよく洗い、内部にある泥砂をとりのぞき、ざるにあげて水気をきる。
sen.e: A production method includes pulling out guts from a sea cucumber with a hernia device, washing the guts well in seawater, removing internal mud and sand off from it, putting it up on a bamboo strainer, and cutting moisture of it.

A production method includes pulling out guts from a sea cucumber with a hernia device, washing the guts well in seawater, removing internal mud and sand off from it, putting it up on a bamboo strainer, and cutting moisture of it.

A production method includes pulling out guts from a sea cucumber with a hernia device, washing the guts well in seawater, removing internal mud and sand off from it, putting it up on a bamboo strainer, and cutting moisture of it.

sen.j: 腸1升に上等塩2合ないし3合をくわえ、かきまぜ、さらに水気をきり、一昼夜 桶または壺に貯蔵する。
sen.e: The method also includes adding excellent salt of 2 or 3 go to guts of 1 sho and mixing it, further cutting moisture of it, and storing in a pail or a pot for twenty-four hours.

The method also includes adding excellent salt of two or tree 'go' (a measuring unit) to guts of one 'sho' (another measuring unit) and mixing it, further cutting moisture of it, and storing in a pail or a pot for twenty-four hours.

The method also includes adding excellent salt of two or tree 'go' (a measuring unit) to guts of one 'sho' (another measuring unit) and mixing it, further cutting moisture of it, and storing in a pail or a pot for twenty-four hours.

sen.j: ナマコ100貫から腸8升が、腸1升からこのわた7合ができる。
sen.e: As a result, guts f 8 sho may be obtained from sea cucumber of 1 kan, Konowata of 7 go from guts of 1 sho.
As a result, guts f 8 sho may be obtained from sea cucumber of 100 'kan' (another measuring unit), Konowata of 7 go from guts of 1 sho.
sen.cmt: 貫の説明追加、数値の修正など
sen.e: As a result, guts f 8 sho may be obtained from sea cucumber of 100 'kan' (another measuring unit), Konowata of 7 go from guts of 1 sho.

sen.j: ふつうは塩蔵されたものが市販される。
sen.e: Generally, salted Namako is put on the market.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Generally, salted Namako is put on the market.
Generally, salted Namako is put on the market.

sen.j: 生（なま）ですすっても三杯酢に漬けても美味である。
sen.e: When eating, raw one or soaked one in mixture of vinegar, soy sauce and sugar is delicious.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When eating, raw one or soaked one in mixture of vinegar, soy sauce and sugar is delicious.
When eating, raw one or soaked one in mixture of vinegar, soy sauce and sugar is delicious.

sen.j: 酒によくあうとよろこばれる。
sen.e: Konowata is pleased to match liquor well.
It is pleased that konowata goes well with sake.
It is pleased that konowata goes well with sake.

sen.j: このわたに熱燗の酒をそそいだものは、「このわた酒」という。
sen.e: Konowata with warmed sake poured is called "konowata shu."
Konowata with warmed sake poured is called "konowata shu."
Konowata with warmed sake poured is called "konowata shu."

sen.j: 「このわた汁」は、このわたをまな板の上で庖丁で叩き、椀に入れ、極く淡仕立ての汁を注ぐ。
sen.e: "Konowata jiru" (konowata soup) is made to tap konowata with a kitchen knife on a cutting board, put it into a wooden bowl, and then pour an extremely light-seasoned soup into the bowl.
"Konowata jiru" (konowata soup) is made by tapping konowata with a kitchen knife on a cutting board, putting it into a wooden bowl, and then pouring an extremely light-seasoned soup into the bowl.
sen.cmt: made to を made byに変更
sen.e: "Konowata jiru" (konowata soup) is made by tapping konowata with a kitchen knife on a cutting board, putting it into a wooden bowl, and then pouring an extremely light-seasoned soup into the bowl.

sen.j: こうすればこのわたの真の味を賞し得るという。
sen.e: It is said that a real taste of konowata can be relished through this way.
It is said that a real taste of konowata can be relished through this way.
It is said that a real taste of konowata can be relished through this way.

sen.j: また味噌仕立てにもされる。
sen.e: Konowata is also cooked with miso.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Konowata is also cooked with miso.
Konowata is also cooked with miso.

sen.j: 三州味噌を庖丁で細かく切り、水で溶き、鰹節、昆布を入れて3時間置く。
sen.e: Hatcho miso is cut finely by the kitchen knife, dissolved with water, and left for three hours with dried bonito and kombu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Cut the hatcho miso finely with a kitchen knife, dissolve in water, add dried bonito and kombu, and then leave it for three hours.
Cut the hatcho miso finely with a kitchen knife, dissolve in water, add dried bonito and kombu, and then leave it for three hours.

sen.j: 裏ごしに掛け、汁を火にかけて味を調える。
sen.e: The miso is strained, and the soup is put on the fire to fix the taste.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Strain the miso, and put the soup on the fire to fix the taste.
Strain the miso, and put the soup on the fire to fix the taste.

sen.j: このわたを加え、さっと煮る。
sen.e: Konowata is added to the soup, and then boiled quickly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Add konowata in the soup and boil quickly.
Add konowata in the soup and boil quickly.
